Package alfdozen.es_2023_2sem_terca_teira_leipl_grupoa

Class ControllerCreateSchedule

java.lang.Object
alfdozen.es_2023_2sem_terca_teira_leipl_grupoa.ControllerCreateSchedule
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ControllerCreateSchedule extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
ControllerCreateSchedule is a controller class for the Create Schedule page. It allows users to select courses and create their schedule. Users can save their schedule as a CSV or JSON file.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
alfdozen

  • Constructor Details

    • ControllerCreateSchedule

      public ControllerCreateSchedule()

  • Method Details

    • createSchedule

      private void createSchedule()
      Creates a schedule based on the selected courses. Adds each course to the calendar view and sets the course color. Handles conflicts between overlapping courses.

    • clearAll

      private void clearAll()
      Clears all the selected courses and the created schedule. Removes all courses from the ListView and calendar view.

    • selectAll

      private void selectAll()
      Selects all courses in the ListView. Adds all available courses to the selected courses list.

    • returnHome

      private void returnHome()
      Returns the user to the main menu. Called when the backButton is clicked. Changes the scene to the Main scene. Shows an appropriate message dialog if there's an error returning to the main menu.

    • saveFileCSV

      private void saveFileCSV()
      Event handler for saving the schedule to a CSV file. Shows a file chooser dialog to select the save location. Saves the schedule to the selected file in CSV format. Displays a success message with the file path if the save is successful. Displays an error message if there is an exception while saving.

    • saveFileJSON

      private void saveFileJSON()
      Event handler for saving the schedule to a JSON file. Shows a file chooser dialog to select the save location. Saves the schedule to the selected file in JSON format. Displays a success message with the file path if the save is successful. Displays an error message if there is an exception while saving.

    • conflicts

      private void conflicts()
      Calls showLectureConflicts from App to show a new stage with a list of all the lecture conflicts in the schedule. The conflicts are displayed using the "Overlayed.fxml" file.

    • viewSchedule

      private void viewSchedule()
      Event handler for viewing the schedule. Sets the root view to the "ViewSchedule" FXML file.

    • setSelectedFields

      private void setSelectedFields()
      Sets the selected fields in the ListView and updates the calendar view accordingly. Clears the previous selection and adds the newly selected items to the list. Updates the calendar view to display the new schedule.

    • clearSchedule

      private void clearSchedule()
      Clears the current schedule from the calendar view. Removes all selected items and entries from the calendar.

    • showSchedule

      private void showSchedule()
      Displays the selected schedule on the calendar view. Clears the previous calendar entries and adds the new schedule entries. Each entry contains information about the lecture, including day, time, and course name.

    • setLecturesToCalendar

      private void setLecturesToCalendar(com.calendarfx.model.Entry<Lecture> aulas, int classDay, LocalTime begin, LocalTime end)
      Checks which weekday each lecture occurs and inserts it into the calendar for the specified day and time interval.
      Parameters:
      aulas - the lectures to set to the calendar
      classDay - the day of the week for the lectures (0 for Monday, 1 for Tuesday, etc.)
      begin - the start time of the lectures
      end - the end time of the lectures

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded. It sets the stage size and title, enables timezone support, and hides the source view. It also adds a listener to the calendar sources, which hides the "Show Calendars" button if it exists. Finally, it calls the setLecturesEntries method to populate the calendar view with lectures.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      arg0 - the URL to the FXML file
      arg1 - the resource bundle associated with the FXML file
